story.storykicker: New Navy Chief Vice Admiral Sunil Lanba succeeds Admiral R. K. Dhowan, who retired after four decades service to the Indian Navy: Scroll to know more.
story.storybody:
On May 31, Vice Admiral Sunil Lanba took charge as the new Chief of the Naval Staff of the Indian Navy, succeeding Admiral R. K. Dhowan. Lanba will be serving as the Chief of the Naval Staff till May 2019.

The government of India made the announcement about Lanba's appointment on May 5. He has been appointed as the 24th Chief of the Naval Staff of the Indian Navy. Lanba handed over his position as the Flag Officer Commanding-in-Chief of the Western Naval Command to Vice Admiral Girish Luthra.

During his long and distinguished service spanning nearly 38 years, Lanba has served in a variety of command, operational and staff appointments.

Here are 12 interesting facts you should know about Vice Admiral Sunil Lanba:

1. Lanba completed his studies at the Mayo College in Ajmer, Rajasthan

2. He had also studied at the National Defense Academy (NDA), the Defense Services Staff College, the Royal College of Defense Studies. He also has a postgraduate degree in defense and management studies

3. Lanba was commissioned in the Indian Navy as a Navigation and Direction Specialist on January 1 in 1978

4. He has served as a navigation officer aboard INS Sindhudurg (K72) and INS Dunagiri (F36)

5. He has also served as the Commanding Officer of INS Kakinada, INS Himgiri (F34), INS Ranvijay (D55) and INS Mumbai (D62)

6. Lanba was the executive officer on board the INS Viraat (R 22)

7. Lanba also took up many administrative roles. He was the Chief of Staff of the Southern Naval Command and later became the Flag Officer of the Sea Training and of the Maharashtra and Gujarat Naval Area

8. After becoming a Vice Admiral, Lanba served as the Chief of Staff of the Eastern Naval Command and later as the commandant of the National Defense College

9. He was then appointed as the Vice Chief of Naval Staff from June 2, 2014 to March 30, 2015

10. Later, he became the face of the western naval fleet as the Fleet Operations Officer of the Western Fleet in Mumbai

11. He was also appointed as the Flag Officer Commanding-in-Chief of the Southern Naval Command on January 31 this year

12. Lanba has received many accolades. He has received the Param Vishisht Seva Medal and the Ati Vishisht Seva Medal.

 

WATCH: Vice Admiral Sunil Lanba takes charge as Navy Chief (Source: ANI)

{blurb}
